Pre-Game Insights: Golden State hosts Memphis in a matchup of Western Conference teams.
The Warriors are 13-12 against Western Conference opponents.
Golden State scores 112.3 points while outscoring opponents by 1.9 points per game.
The Grizzlies are 10-9 in conference play.
Memphis is second in the NBA with 12.9 offensive rebounds per game led by Zach Edey averaging 3.7.
The Warriors are shooting 44.8% from the field this season, 0.4 percentage points higher than the 44.4% the Grizzlies allow to opponents.
The Grizzlies average 14.3 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.1 more made shots on average than the 13.2 per game the Warriors give up.
Stephen Curry is shooting 44.7% and averaging 22.3 points for the Warriors.
Santi Aldama is averaging 13 points and 7.3 rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Warriors' last 10 games: 3-7, averaging 108.2 points, 43.9 rebounds, 27.7 assists, 8.2 steals and 6.1 blocks per game while shooting 43.4% from the field.
Grizzlies' last 10 games: 6-3, averaging 127.0 points, 51.3 rebounds, 31.1 assists, 9.2 steals and 5.1 blocks per game while shooting 46.6% from the field.
Others: Injuries for Warriors: Stephen Curry (knee), Andrew Wiggins (hamstring), Brandin Podziemski (abdominal), Gary Payton II (calf).
Injuries for Grizzlies: Marcus Smart (finger), Santi Aldama (ankle), Yuki Kawamura (shoulder), Vince Williams Jr. (ankle), Ja Morant (ac joint), GG Jackson II (foot).
